    public class SpatialObjectPropertyDescriptor
extends it.emarolab.owloop.aMORDescriptor.utility.MORObjectPropertyBase
implements it.emarolab.owloop.aMORDescriptor.MORObjectProperty.Inverse<SpatialObjectPropertyDescriptor>, SITBase
    The OWLOOP Descriptor for an object property representing a spatial relation.

    This is an OWLDataProperty Descriptor based on the OWLOOP API. Since the system needs anyway to hard code the name of the spatial relation in the OBJECT_PROPERTY interface, this Descriptor does not really synchronise any semantics since working with string is much faster.

    File: it.emarolab.sit.owloopDescriptor.SpatialObjectPropertyDescriptor
    Licence: GNU GENERAL PUBLIC LICENSE. Version 3, 29 June 2007
    Author: Buoncompagni Luca (luca.buoncompagni@edu.unige.it)
    affiliation: EMAROLab, DIBRIS, University of Genoa.
    date: 05/06/17

        Parameters:
        instance - the OWL object property managed by this Descriptor.
        onto - the OWLReferences to an ontology hosting the described object property.

    • Method Detail

      • readSemantic

        @Deprecated
public java.util.List<it.emarolab.owloop.core.Semantic.MappingIntent> readSemantic()
        Deprecated. 
        This method does not do nothing. Use getSpatialInverse() and isSpatialSymmetric(). Those methods are much faster and we have to add the name of the spatial relation anyway.

      • isSpatialSymmetric

        public boolean isSpatialSymmetric()
        It returns if this property is symmetric or not by looking in the constants coded into the SITBase.OBJECT_PROPERTY.
        Returns:
        true if this relation is symmetric false otherwise.

        Returns:
        the name of the inverse property. null if it is not known.
